The recruiter immediately followed up with me and provided interviews for 2 different Behavioral Health Positions within the hospital.
Interview Questions: Demonstrate a role play detailing how you would discuss behavioral issues with a teacher whom doesn't understand how to teach to students with learning disabilities.

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: First did phone interview, then the in-person interview, interview was very easy due to I had a lot of experience in the cleaning. Then we talk about compensation of the position interviewer stated it would be on the high side but when I the recruiter call me it and told me the amount I would be making it was actually on the low side
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Nationwide Children's Hospital?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Omaha, NE) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with HR.
Drug test
background check 
6 days later get formal interview with Management in my area
than 4 days later get called for scheduling for the job.
Is huge processes that half time didn't know if I passed or not.
Had personality test and math test and typing test which passed all on certain score they have.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at these hospital?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was given a phone interview about 3 weeks later. I then met with 3 senior leaders 4 days later and was given the position via telephone 2 hours later. Nothing stood out about the interview process. They were more interested in my interests and why I wanted to work for the organization.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to become a manager?

title: RN Clinic Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Several interviews with recruiter, with hiring managers, hiring manager professional, recruiter absolutely rude and unprofessional
Interview Questions: Nothing was unusual

title: Synagis Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter from HR called me one random day, and told me that the manager of Homecare specifically requested me for a new position they opened up. I applied online and the next week I had an interview. It was a one on one interview with the hiring manager. Second interview was with the team.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself. What qualities do you have that could utilize in this position?

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial phone interview after the connection had been established by my PhD mentor. We then had a casual interview during which we discussed my research experience, career trajectory, interests, skills, etc. I had already been working for another PI in Research, so we also discussed what I was currently doing and what I was hoping to get from a new position in terms of content, schedule, and tuition funding. Several more emails, phone calls, and informal meetings happened before the university worked out joint funding with the research department I was going to work with.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do when you finish your PhD?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I Applied online.   received a call from HR to do and phone interview.  Waited a week then received call to set up interview.  Met wth HR rep and went over generalities then met with the hiring manager.  Salary is not confirmed.   Once I received the job offer you will need to negotiate salary at that time,  Before starting you will be scheduled for a drug and TB testing as well as ID picture session.   Then you will attend a two day long orientation.
Interview Questions: why nationwide.   Big on people choosing to work here for more than just money

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received call from HR department a few weeks later. Interviewed with HR and then met with the unit manager the same day. Received offer the following week.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time you were involved in conflict in the work environment and how you handled it.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position, it took quite some time to get a call back along with several calls to HR to follow up. In addition my referral continuously called the employer to ask them to interview me. Once I received a phone call to come in for an interview I had a one on one with someone in HR, then they forwarded my information to move on to second/third interview with someone in the specific department I applied for. Once at my final interview it was myself along with 2 department supervisors and they extended the offer. I have also applied for job transfers within Children's, at that point if they decide to interview you for the position, you skip the interview with HR and move directly into the series of interviews within the department as well as a job shadow to make sure it is a good fit. During one of my interviews it was 4:1 and they used a lot of pressure to see if you are a good fit and can handle high stress situations. (There was a series of 3 interviews and then 1 job shadowing to make sure was a good fit).
Interview Questions: How to handle certain workplace situations (Ex: how to deal with irate patients, difficult situations you have dealt with, how to handle workplace hostility). Also why I felt I would be a good fit and what I had to offer to the department. They also asked me if I understood the job responsibilities of the position I applied for.

title: Systems Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: First, you meet with a representative from Human Resources.  She will ask you general questions that try to size up your personality.  Then you interview with your potential manager and they will ask more position-centric questions and give you a technical assessment.  Usually the assessment is JavaScript or .NET.  After that, there is a panel interview with the people that you would actually work with, and yes they are judging your abilities and whether or not they want to work with you.  After that, it's usually a week before you get an offer.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you worked with someone who was difficult to work with and what did you do to alleviate the problem?

title: Data Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I was considering a salary position after being out on my own consulting as a software architect and manager for over 5 years.  When I showed up at HR it was like they were herding cattle.   When the receptionist pointed me to the no cell phone sign I promptly left the building to complete my conversation.  The meeting with the HR person for the specific IT department went like this.  

IT HR:  What are you looking to make?
ME:  What is the salary range?
IT HR:  I can only tell you the bottom of the range is 56,000
ME:  That's less than I was making in 1999 (10+ yrs ago).  I'm over six figures now.
(at this point the HR person was ready to end the interview had I not said...)
ME:  Why don't I meet the team and talk to them for a bit and find out what type of things they are working on.

(at which point I had a great conversation about the impact and opportunity of the Internet on Healthcare, and mobile technologies, with a couple middle managers for 1.5 hours.  During the conversation it became clear they wanted an ETL/database monkey and the position was not for me, but it was a nice conversation none the less.)
Interview Questions: How much are you looking to make?

title: Senior IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Easy interviiew
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Simple. Submit using online tool. Arrive to sign for drug test and speak with recruiter. Quick notification.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Psychology Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had to go through the national internship match service, APPIC.
Interview Questions: I didn't have any difficult questions, the process was more conversational

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was already working at Children's, so the first interview was in person. A little bit of a meet and greet. The second interview was a ssh session and assessment of my programming skills. There were three questions, that were mostly scripting based questions. I also met with the rest of the staff. After accepting the job, and then going through the process from the other perspective, meeting the staff is important and is used to determine if the interviewee is a good fit.
Interview Questions: Because this is a position that involved biological research, there was a question that went deeper into my biological knowledge than I expected. Be prepared to answer questions from all areas.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR a couple of weeks after I submitted my application online. I first interviewed with an HR manager and the interview questions were pretty typical. I then moved on to move to the department that I worked in to do an interview with people who were on my team. They were incredibly nice and genuinely seemed interested in my work experience. I felt comfortable the entire time. They had other candidates to interview after me, so I was offered the job about 2 weeks later and accepted.
Interview Questions: Name a difficulty work experience you had to overcome.

title: Sponsored Projects Officer Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Human resources phone screen was well organized and informative. Human resources 1:1 interview consisted of mostly background/experience questions and was well managed. Direct manager 1:1 interview consisted of questions and discussion on how background/experience would relate to the position and specific position details. Panel interview with individuals in the position I was interviewing for was unexpected and personnel were rather unfriendly, disinterested and unhelpful, mostly taking occasion to discuss why someone would not want this job.
Interview Questions: How much time are you comfortable sitting at a computer?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone/E-mail contact with department admin. & main doctor.  Flew down from NYC for an interview. Talked to several doctors and went to several locations where they see patients/do research.  More informal discussion of my background, what the job entails, etc.  I paid for my own flight & hotel room etc., followed up twice when I got home, and NEVER heard back from anyone.  Unprofessional, horrible, and just lacking the common decency to give me a call or send me an e-mail to let me know if I had gotten the job or not.
Interview Questions: What was your thesis about?

title: Human Resources Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Received a quick response to application submitted; interview was professional
Interview Questions: None were difficult or unexpected

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Nationwide Children's Hospital (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions: It was a well designed process that was easy to follow and involved many interviews.
Interview Questions: How would your experience help in your new role?
